remarks: Two functions that are eventually equal to one another are eventually bounded if one of them is.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-May-2016.)
statement:
lo1eq.1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> B e. RR ) $.
lo1eq.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> C e. RR ) $.
lo1eq.3 $e |- ( ph -> D e. RR ) $.
lo1eq.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. A /\ D <_ x ) ) -> B = C ) $.
lo1eq $p |- ( ph -> ( ( x e. A |-> B ) e. <_O(1) <-> ( x e. A |-> C ) e. <_O(1) ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d D x $.
$d ph x $.
